line-7: Key Vacancy Information:Job Title: Asset Engineer (Managed Stations)Role Type: Full Time, PermanentLocation: York George Stephenson House Closing date: 25th December 2023Salary: salary starting at £43,588 and increasing to £49,037 (plus Employee Healthcare)Annual Leave: 28 days + bank holidaysHours: 35 per week *Employees will be entitled to a 75% discount off leisure, this includes all Advance, off peak and super off peak tickets* About Network Rail: Network Rail has played a key role in keeping the country moving during the coronavirus pandemic – and we will play an equally important part in rebuilding from it.We get people where they need to be, whether they are commuting to work, visiting friends or family, or going for a night out.We make millions of lives better every day and have a vital job in driving the economy and prosperity of the nation!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLZ7OYSoQVUOver the coming years we will be building and improving crucial rail links between the country’s biggest cities, making our services faster, more comfortable and more reliable for the people who rely on us.We’re also changing our organisation to put the passenger at the heart of everything we do, to make our people even prouder to work for us and to be recognised as a true leader in our industry.In joining Network Rail, you’re not only joining an organisation with a vital role to play for the country, but also a team of more than 40,000 people, and a business dedicated to being one of Britain’s best employers.
line-9: Manage the maintenance and renewal of the route Managed Station assets [Building Fabric] to deliver Network Rail’s goals. Provide engineering expertise on Managed Station building fabric maintenance, renewal and enhancement matters.
line-11: Key Accountabilities – 1. Provide the asset stewardship and inspection of managed stations building fabric assets (Managed Stations) in accordance with asset policy and technical strategy and specify the maintenance and renewal works required. 2. Make recommendations and instructions for repair and renewal works required and assist with the development and management of prioritised route maintenance and renewal work banks and integrated plans. Assist with the preparation of details for national and route periodic business plan reviews. Manage changes and outputs to integrated plans for operational property assets. 3. Lead the production of maintenance, renewal and enhancement (PRS) remits which specify the work necessary to deliver Network Rail’s goals and their inclusion in the workbank. Oversee the development and implementation of schemes to verify whether requirements are sufficient, correctly interpreted and delivered. Specify and monitor the implementation of control measures where proposed works are deferred. 4. Act as sponsor for complex and specialist maintenance and all renewal schemes. Discharge all sponsor’s accountabilities in accordance with corporate policy. 5. Support the asset management / engineering analysis and risk assessment of maintenance and renewals schemes during the early development phase, in compliance with Network Rail’s standards and procedures and develop business cases for schemes, where appropriate. 6. Review proposals from other asset groups or external organisations that impact on maintenance or renewal activity, identify potential synergies and develop optimised plans as applicable. 7. Support the monitoring of trends in maintenance and renewal work, asset condition, failure and failure precursors. Confirm that appropriate action is specified to predict and prevent similar failures. 8. Provide engineering support and participate in investigations of incidents relating to managed stations building fabric maintenance and renewals. 9. Liaise with portfolio occupiers and stakeholders for asset stewardship purposes, report on tenant lease non-compliance and manage the monitoring of tenant dilapidations with particular reference to managed stations building fabric. 10. Assist with the management og the PPM programme of works (Building Fabric – Managed Stations) in accordance with the Operational Property National Remit. Review and audit delivery against remit. 11. Assist with the management of the technical approval process of landlords consent applications for all non Network Rail works at Managed Stations and ensure compliance with agreed targets for close out / completion of approvals. Essential · HND/HNC or equivalent qualification in a relevant subject · Significant relevant experience of operational property engineering · Knowledge of policies and standards relating to managed stations · Working towards membership of a relevant professional institution Desirable · Member of a relevant professional body, MCIOB / MRICS · Degree or equivalent qualification in a relevant subject · Incorporated or Chartered Engineer
